description:
This dataset lists samples of carbonate crusts formed under the ice of the East Antarctic Ice Sheet.  These crusts mostly consist of Calcium Carbonate (CaCO3),  and have ages spanning from older than 400,000 years to circa 17,000 years.
The dataset "samples" provides the name for each specimen, where it was collected (Geographic Coordinates), its mineralogical composition and where the samples are archived.
The list of samples is: 
PRR13055 Elephant Moraine    Geographic Coord: -76.313  157.244  Composition: Calcite plus SiO2
PRR13074 Elephant Moraine    Geographic Coord: -76.313  157.244   Composition: Calcite plus SiO2                             
PRR13290 Elephant Moraine    Geographic Coord: -76.313  157.244   Composition: Calcite plus SiO2 
PRR13081 Elephant Moraine    Geographic Coord: -76.313  157.244   Composition: Calcite plus SiO2 
PRR16794 Elephant Moraine    Geographic Coord: -76.313  157.244   Composition: Calcite  
PRR23247 Elephant Moraine    Geographic Coord: -76.313  157.244   Composition: Calcite plus SiO2 
PRR23258 Elephant Moraine    Geographic Coord: -76.313  157.244   Composition: Calcite plus SiO2 
PRR23259 Elephant Moraine    Geographic Coord: -76.313 157.244    Composition: Calcite plus SiO2 
PRR39222 Elephant Moraine    Geographic Coord: -76.313  157.244   Composition: Calcite plus SiO2 
VH-V2        Vestfold Hills           Geographic Coord:  -68.570   78.364    Composition: Calcite, Aragonite, silicates  SiO2
BH1            Bunger Hill              Geographic Coord:  -66.264 100.860    Composition: Calcite, Aragonite (?), silicates
BV8            Boggs Valley           Geographic Coord:  -71.912  161.525   Composition: Calcite 
BV9b          Boggs Valley           Geographic Coord:  -71.912  161.525   Composition: Calcite 

All the Elephant Hill Moraine samples were obtained from the Polar Rock Repository, Ohio Uni (US), which lends samples for scientific research upon request (visit https://bit.ly/3kfHtgi). Samples from Vestfold Hills, Bunger Hill, Boggs Valley  were sourced from the collection of Paul Augustinus, University of Auckland, New Zealand. All Boggs Valley samples were collected during the K15A event supported by Antarctica New Zealand.
title: Antarctic subglacial carbonates as archives of subglacial volcanism and Life in extreme conditions - Samples
